content.description: Hard and committing highball slab.Begin with high L-Hand on a positive crescent crimp and R-Hand on a square sidepull corner. Climb straight up the technical slab to a big throw/deadpoint to a flat ledge and highball topout.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVBqu0GR0HI
content.location: Stand start at the flat to hillside transition on the rightside of the Big Tex/Penny Slab wall

content.description: Very classic and powerful boulder problem starting on Big Tex and moving right on a giant L-Hand windmill to the starting crescent hold of penny slab.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVBqu0GR0HI

Highball power test piece.Begin on essentially the same hold as PND.Squat-start/psuedo sds on positive holds ~should width apart. Make several fairly easy moves on positive holds to a strange spragly R-Hand pocket pinch. Make a big L-hand reach to a pocket/crimp, match and make a big L-Hand toss to another pocket. Loadup and make another big toss R-Hand to the lip. Cross up L-hand to positive holds and summon the courage to commit to the final top out moves in a NO FALL ZONE. Proud. Hard. Classic.Matt Dendy on the First Ascent of Big Tex: youtube.com/watch?v=TTLE1cT…
Big Tex in a classic powerful highball put up by Matt Dendy. There are some over classic lines in this zone.
